attributes.action: Ban sales of all items that use eggs from caged hens
attributes.additional_details: I think that the sale of eggs from caged hens is an absolute abomination; farmers profit from the suffering of chickens in cakes where they are tightly packed together and are expected to produce 320 eggs in their first 72 weeks of laying, that's nearly 46 eggs a week! On average a free-range chicken lays 5-6 a week.
attributes.background: I want the UK government to ban the sale of eggs from caged hens but also to ban the sale of products that have eggs from caged hens in them eg. mayonnaise, cakes, biscuits and many more
